text.summary: This excerpt from a history book tells about the American Civil War, describing economic hardships for the Confederacy, its failure to obtain support from Great Britain and France, and the role of African American Union soldiers in the war.
text.summary2: This section of a textbook describes the political and economic reasons behind the triumph of the Union over the Confederacy during the Civil War, including railroad lines, industry, and British support, before detailing the involvement of African-American soldiers in the Union war effort and the hardships they faced due to racism.
